beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Gravel Brazil? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Gravel Brazil scored 71 out of 100. Elite tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Gravel Brazil. Balneário Camboriú, Santa Catarina, Brazil. 62 mi. 100 km, 2,000 m. 80% gravel, 20% dirt. Brazilian coastal mountains. Steep climbs, technical descents. Technical rating: 4/5.
beats.text_on_screen: Gravel Brazil | Balneário Camboriú, Santa Catarina, Brazil | 62 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Time to break down the scorecard. Adventure. 5 out of 5. Adventure is the entire point. First UCI gravel race in Southern America—you're literally writing the book. Experience. 5 out of 5. Transformative. People come back different. You're pioneering gravel racing in Brazil—that's bucket list territory. Value. 5 out of 5. Dollar for dollar, one of the best in gravel. First gravel race in Southern America for unknown entry fees offers historical access at presumably reasonable Brazilian pricing. Technicality. 4 out of 5. Bike handling matters here. Practice your descents. 650bisnotdead built specifically for Brazilian conditions: "I choose 650b for being far versatile than 700c for different tires. Elevation. 4 out of 5. Your power-to-weight ratio matters here. 6,562 feet in 62 miles delivers over 100 feet of climbing per mile. Prestige. 4 out of 5. Top-shelf reputation. Calendar priority. First UCI Gravel race in Southern America carries serious weight—you're making history just by showing up. Race Quality. 4 out of 5. High-quality event. Attention to detail shows. UCI sanctioning means organization standards backed by the team behind Gran Fondo Brazil. Community. 4 out of 5. The post-race scene is half the event. Brazilian cycling culture runs deep, with riders enthusiastic about sharing their builds for tropical conditions.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The remaining six. Quick-fire. Length. 3 out of 5. Long enough to matter. Short enough to recover. Climate. 3 out of 5. The weather could go either way. Field Depth. 3 out of 5. Good racing at every level. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Mid-range expenses. Budget a proper race weekend. Logistics. 2 out of 5. Basic setup. Don't expect hand-holding. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Brazilian Beach Town Mountains. If you need UCI points or want to say you raced Brazil's inaugural gravel event, this makes sense. The 6.6 thousand feet of climbing over 62 miles suggests sustained suffering, not punchy attacks. Show up ready for humidity, unknown surfaces, and the chaos that comes with first-year events where nothing goes according to plan.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Gravel Brazil isn't quite right for you. Unbound Gravel gives you proven difficulty and community without the travel gamble. SBT GRVL delivers similar climbing with mountain views and established logistics if you want your suffering served with competence.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.
